name.text: Quadratic Identities - Area Model for Numerical Squares

questiontext.text:
We can use the quadratic identity \((a+b)^2 = a^2 + 2ab + b^2\) to calculate squares of large numbers mentally.

Imagine a square garden with a side length of {@total_num@} m. We can split this length into {@base_val@} m and {@offset_val@} m.

Use the Area Model diagram below to calculate the area of each section, and then find the total area of the garden.

[[jsxgraph]] /* Define specific drawing coordinates to ensure the diagram looks good */ /* We don't use the actual values (e.g. 50 and 3) because 3 would be too small to see */ var b_draw = 6; /* Drawing size for the big square */ var o_draw = 2; /* Drawing size for the small square */ var total_draw = b_draw + o_draw; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-1, total_draw + 1, total_draw + 1, -1], axis: false, showCopyright: false, keepaspectratio: true }); /* 1. Draw the Main Outer Square Points */ var p1 = board.create('point', [0, 0], {visible:false}); var p2 = board.create('point', [total_draw, 0], {visible:false}); var p3 = board.create('point', [total_draw, total_draw], {visible:false}); var p4 = board.create('point', [0, total_draw], {visible:false}); /* Draw Outer Border */ board.create('polygon', [p1, p2, p3, p4], { borders: {strokeColor:'black', strokeWidth:2}, fillColor: 'none' }); /* 2. Define Split Points */ var split_x = board.create('point', [b_draw, 0], {visible:false}); var split_y = board.create('point', [0, o_draw], {visible:false}); /* Split from top downwards visually, or bottom up. Let's do bottom-left is big. */ /* Actually, standard math diagram usually puts big square at bottom-left or top-left. Let's do Bottom-Left as Big. */ var split_x_top = board.create('point', [b_draw, total_draw], {visible:false}); var split_y_right = board.create('point', [total_draw, b_draw], {visible:false}); var center = board.create('point', [b_draw, b_draw], {visible:false}); var left_split = board.create('point', [0, b_draw], {visible:false}); /* 3. Draw Dividing Lines */ board.create('segment', [left_split, split_y_right], {strokeColor:'gray', dash:2}); board.create('segment', [split_x, split_x_top], {strokeColor:'gray', dash:2}); /* 4. Label the Sides (Using the STACK variables) */ /* Bottom Labels */ board.create('text', [b_draw/2, -0.5, "{#base_val#}"], {anchorX:'middle'}); board.create('text', [b_draw + o_draw/2, -0.5, "{#offset_val#}"], {anchorX:'middle'}); /* Left Labels */ board.create('text', [-0.5, b_draw/2, "{#base_val#}"], {anchorX:'middle'}); board.create('text', [-0.5, b_draw + o_draw/2, "{#offset_val#}"], {anchorX:'middle'}); /* 5. Color the Regions */ /* Big Square (Bottom-Left) */ board.create('polygon', [p1, split_x, center, left_split], {fillColor:'#d1e7dd', borders:{visible:false}}); board.create('text', [b_draw/2, b_draw/2, "A"], {fontSize:16}); /* Small Square (Top-Right) */ board.create('polygon', [center, split_y_right, p3, split_x_top], {fillColor:'#f8d7da', borders:{visible:false}}); board.create('text', [b_draw + o_draw/2, b_draw + o_draw/2, "D"], {fontSize:16}); /* Rectangles */ board.create('polygon', [left_split, center, split_x_top, p4], {fillColor:'#fff3cd', borders:{visible:false}}); board.create('text', [b_draw/2, b_draw + o_draw/2, "B"], {fontSize:16}); board.create('polygon', [split_x, p2, split_y_right, center], {fillColor:'#fff3cd', borders:{visible:false}}); board.create('text', [b_draw + o_draw/2, b_draw/2, "C"], {fontSize:16}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Part 1: Find the area of each section.

Area A (Big Square): \( {@base_val@}^2 = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]
Area B (Rectangle): \( {@base_val@} \times {@offset_val@} = \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]
Area C (Rectangle): \( {@offset_val@} \times {@base_val@} = \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]
Area D (Small Square): \( {@offset_val@}^2 = \) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

Part 2: Total Area

Add the four areas together to find the total area of the garden (which equals \({@total_num@}^2\)).

Total Area = [[input:ans5]] \(m^2\) [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution:

We are calculating \({@total_num@}^2\) by breaking it down into \({@exp_step@}\).

Using the identity \((a+b)^2 = a^2 + 2ab + b^2\), where \(a={@base_val@}\) and \(b={@offset_val@}\):

  • Region A (\(a^2\)): \({@base_val@}^2 = {@area_A@}\)
  • Region B (\(ab\)): \({@base_val@} \times {@offset_val@} = {@area_B@}\)
  • Region C (\(ba\)): \({@offset_val@} \times {@base_val@} = {@area_C@}\)
  • Region D (\(b^2\)): \({@offset_val@}^2 = {@area_D@}\)

Adding them together:

\[ {@area_A@} + {@area_B@} + {@area_C@} + {@area_D@} = \mathbf{{@total_area@}} \]
